Package tage.ai.behaviortrees

Class BTCondition

java.lang.Object
tage.ai.behaviortrees.BTBehavior
tage.ai.behaviortrees.BTCondition
public abstract class BTCondition extends BTBehavior
A BTCondition node is a leaf node that performs a boolean check on read-only data gathered from the game world. If the check returns TRUE then the node returns SUCCESS. If the check returns FALSE then the node returns FAILURE. Users wanting to create condition nodes do so by extending this class and implementing the check() method.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • BTCondition

      public BTCondition(boolean toNegate)
      Constructs a BTCondition.
      Parameters:
      toNegate - TRUE if the value returned by check() should be NOTed; otherwise FALSE.

  • Method Details

    • check

      protected abstract boolean check()
      Conducts the condition check. This method is meant to be overridden by a class that extends BTCondition.
      Returns:
      TRUE if the condition passes; FALSE otherwise.

    • update

      protected BTStatus update(float elapsedTime)
      Updates the BTCondition node. Calls the protected check() method. If the node is set to negation then the return value from check() will be NOTed. If the value from check() is TRUE then the node returns BH_SUCCESS. If the value from check() is FALSE then the node returns BH_FAILURE.
      Specified by:
      update in class BTBehavior
      Parameters:
      elapsedTime - Time since the last call to BaseGame.update()
      Returns:
      The return BTStatus of the node.
